biolockj.module.seq

Class Multiplexer

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.module.BioModuleImpl
      • biolockj.module.ScriptModuleImpl
        • biolockj.module.JavaModuleImpl
          • biolockj.module.seq.Multiplexer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BioModule, JavaModule, ScriptModule, SeqModule, Comparable<BioModule>

    public class Multiplexer
extends JavaModuleImpl
implements JavaModule, SeqModule
    This BioModule will merge sequence files into a single combined sequence file, with either the sample ID or an identifying bar-code (if defined in the metatata) is stored in the sequence header.
    BioLockJ is designed to run on demultiplexed data so this must be the last module to run in its branch.
    GUI Module Name
    Multiplexer

      • checkDependencies

        public void checkDependencies()
                       throws Exception
        Validate module dependencies:
        1. Validate this is the last module to run (excluding Email)
        If this module was completed on a previous run, update the property: Config."internal.multiplexed" = "Y"
        Specified by:

      • getSeqFiles

        public List<File> getSeqFiles(Collection<File> files)
                       throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: SeqModule
        Return only sequence files for sample IDs found in the metadata file.
        If Config."metadata.required" = "Y", an error is thrown to list the files that cannot be matched to a metadata row.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        files - Module input files
        Returns:
        Module sequence files
        Throws:

      • getHeader

        protected String getHeader(File file,
                           List<String> seqLines)
                    throws Exception
        Get the header for the sequence.
        Parameters:
        file - Sequence file in fasta or fastq format
        seqLines - Sequence lines for 1 read
        Returns:
        the header row for the sequence
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur while obtaining header

      • multiplex

        protected void multiplex(File sample)
                  throws Exception
        Add file sequences to the multiplexed file. If barcode is defined in the metadata file and set in the Config file, it will be added to the header (if not already in the header line). If no barcode value is configured, the sample ID will be used in the sequence headers.
        Parameters:
        sample - Sequence file in Fasta or Fastq format
        Throws:
        Exception - if I/O errors occur creating multiplexed file

      • validateModuleOrder

        protected void validateModuleOrder()
                            throws Exception
        This method ensures that the multiplexed data is not passed to other modules.
        This must be the last module, or last module before the Email.
        Throws:
        Exception - if not the last module before Email
